A divine mother, the personified energy of a deity or his wife; in a figurative sense, a mother to mortals; eight divine MÄtris are enumerated, BRÄ€HMÄª, the MÄtri of BRAHMÄ€; MAHEÅšWARÄª, the MÄtri of ÅšIVA; VAISHNAVÄª, of VISHá¹†U; AINDRÄª, of INDRA; VÄ€RÄ€HÄª, of VISHá¹†U, as the VarÄha AvatÄr; KAUMÄ€RÄª, of KÄ€RTIKEYA; KAUVERÄª or CHÄ€MUNDÄ€ of KUVERA, and CHARCHIKÄ€ of ÅšIVA, in one of his minor incarnations; another list calls them MAHEÅšWARÄª, BRÄ€HMÄª, NÄ€RÄ€YANÄª, AINDRÄª, VARÄ€HÄª, KAUMÄ€RÄª, NARASÄªNHÄª, and APARÄ€JITÄ€, differing from the preceding one in the two last names, the first one of which, is the energy of VISHá¹†U in the Narasinha AvatÄr, and the latter a form of DURGÄ€; another enumeration makes the MÄtris sixteen, and another but seven. 3.
